name: Chemistry HL
description: IB Chemistry covers the fundamental concepts of chemistry from atomic structure to organic chemistry. HL students study additional topics including advanced organic chemistry, more detailed energetics, and electrochemistry.

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 1
assessmentComponents.description: Multiple choice questions on core and AHL material
assessmentComponents.structure: 40 multiple choice questions. Calculator allowed. Data booklet provided.

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 2
assessmentComponents.structure: Section A: Short-answer and data-based questions (all compulsory). Section B: Extended response - choose 2 from 3. Section C: Extended response - choose 1 from 2.
markingCriteria: Use correct units and significant figures

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 3
assessmentComponents.description: Data-based questions on experimental work plus Option questions
assessmentComponents.structure: Section A: Data-based and practical questions (compulsory). Section B: Questions on ONE chosen Option.

assessmentComponents.name: Internal Assessment
assessmentComponents.description: Individual Investigation - scientific investigation report (6-12 pages)
assessmentComponents.structure: Criteria: Personal engagement (8%), Exploration (25%), Analysis (25%), Evaluation (25%), Communication (17%)

assessmentObjectives.description: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of facts and concepts

mathsRequirements: Students should be comfortable with: algebraic manipulation, logarithms (for pH calculations), graphical analysis, significant figures, scientific notation, and basic calculus concepts (for rate equations at HL).
practicalRequirements: Minimum 40 hours of practical work including titrations, calorimetry, electrochemical cells, organic synthesis, and qualitative analysis.
iaGuidelines: The IA should demonstrate experimental skills and understanding of chemistry concepts. Topics should allow for collection of sufficient quantitative data and meaningful analysis.
